AFG31000 Function Generator

The AFG31000 class provides control for Tektronix AFG31000 series function generators.

Basic Usage

from AFG31000 import AFG31000

# Auto-discover and connect
afg = AFG31000()

# Configure channel 1
afg.set_frequency(1, 1000)        # 1 kHz
afg.set_waveform_type(1, 'SQUare') # Square wave
afg.set_amplitude(1, 2.0)         # 2 Vpp
afg.set_offset(1, 0.0)            # 0V offset
afg.set_output(1, 'ON')           # Enable output

# Clean up
afg.close()

Key Features

Auto-Discovery

Automatically finds connected AFG instruments via VISA.

Dual Channel Control

Control both channels independently with different waveforms.

Multiple Waveforms

Supports sine, square, pulse, ramp, noise, and more.

Load Impedance

Set output load impedance (50Ω, 75Ω, high-Z, etc.).

Common Methods

Waveform Configuration:

afg.set_waveform_type(channel, 'SINusoid')  # Sine wave
afg.set_frequency(channel, 10e3)            # 10 kHz
afg.set_amplitude(channel, 1.0)             # 1 Vpp
afg.set_offset(channel, 0.5)                # 0.5V offset

Output Control:

afg.set_output(channel, 'ON')    # Enable output
afg.set_load(channel, 50)        # 50 ohm load
afg.set_phase(channel, 90, 'DEG') # 90 degree phase

Utility:

device_id = afg.device_id()              # Get device info
instruments = AFG31000.list_all_instruments()  # List all instruments

Available Waveforms

  • SINusoid - Sine wave

  • SQUare - Square wave

  • PULSe - Pulse waveform

  • RAMP - Ramp/triangle wave

  • PRNoise - Pseudo-random noise

  • DC - DC level

  • SINC - Sinc function

  • GAUSsian - Gaussian pulse

  • LORentz - Lorentzian curve

  • EXPRise - Exponential rise

  • EXPDecay - Exponential decay

  • HAVersine - Haversine function

Connection Options

# Auto-discovery (recommended)
afg = AFG31000()

# Specific IP address
afg = AFG31000(ip_address="192.168.1.100")

# Serial port
afg = AFG31000(serial_port="COM1")

# Direct VISA resource
afg = AFG31000(resource_name="USB0::0x0699::0x035E::C019451::INSTR")

API Reference

Bases: object

check_device_id(strict=False)[source]

Check if the device ID matches the expected value.

Parameters:

strict (bool) – If True, checks for specific model ‘AFG31252’. If False, checks for any AFG instrument.

Returns:

True if device ID matches expected pattern, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

Get the phase for a specified channel.

Parameters:

  • channel – Channel number (1 or 2)

  • unit – ‘DEG’ for degrees (default) or ‘RAD’ for radians

Returns:

set_amplitude(channel, amplitude)[source]

Set the amplitude for a specified channel in Volts peak-to-peak.

set_frequency(channel, frequency)[source]

Set the frequency for a specified channel in Hz.

set_frequency_lock(state)[source]

Set the frequency lock state for both channels.

set_load(channel, impedance)[source]

Set the load impedance for a specified channel in Ohms.

Parameters:

  • channel – Channel number (1 or 2)

  • impedance – Load impedance value. Can be: - Numeric value (int/float) between 1 and 10000 Ohms - Numeric string (e.g., “50”, “75”) between 1 and 10000 Ohms - “INFinity” for >10 kΩ (high impedance) - “MINimum” for 1 Ω - “MAXimum” for 10 kΩ - “HIGHZ” (alias for INFinity)

The device has 1 Ω resolution with 3 significant digits. Default is 50 Ω.

set_offset(channel, offset)[source]

Set the DC offset for a specified channel in Volts.

set_output(channel, state)[source]

Set the output state for a specified channel.

set_phase(channel, phase, unit='DEG')[source]

Set the phase for a specified channel.

Parameters:

  • channel – Channel number (1 or 2)

  • phase – Phase value

  • unit – ‘DEG’ for degrees (default) or ‘RAD’ for radians

set_waveform_type(channel, waveform_type)[source]

Set the waveform type for a specified channel.

Write a command to the device.
